Key Match Events: South Africa won the toss and opted to bat first.
Ryan Rickelton and Tristan Stubbs mounted a remarkable fightback with a 152-run partnership.
Lungi Ngidi took crucial wickets and contributed with the bat.
Ireland struggled to capitalize on early success after South Africa's top-order collapse.
Pre-Game Insights: Temba Bavuma, SA Captain: We’re going to bat. It’s a good wicket, with nice grass covering on it. Want to make use of the good batting conditions. It might do a bit under the lights. We’re not used to this (heat) back home. The next couple of days is our focus. For now, we want to put our best foot forward. Quite a lot of cricket before the Champions Trophy. Some changes from the Afghanistan series. We have a debutant in Ottniel Baartman.

Paul Stirling, IRE Captain: Very proud moment (to play 400 games), back to business though, we’ve got a game to win. It was a difficult decision at the toss, happy to have a bowl. With the dew coming in, it might get a bit difficult later, we’ll take it over by over. Gavin Hoey makes his debut today.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa's lower order contributed valuable runs to push the total to a competitive score.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 20 overs per side.
Ryan Rickelton and Tristan Stubbs' partnership was the turning point of the match.
Debutants Gavin Hoey and Ottniel Baartman played significant roles in the match.
